nodes.text: Wrobie Tyce

Wrobie Tyce was a human female pilot serving the Resistance. The wife of the human Larma D'Acy. Tyce served as a courier pilot until D'Acy decided to join the Resistance movement, a venture that Tyce not only supported, but also joined, serving in Cobalt Squadron and flying an RZ-2 A-wing interceptor. She escaped being killed along with the rest of Cobalt Squadron at the retreat from D'Qar in 34 ABY, as she was away on a separate mission.

In 35 ABY, she was present on the moon Ajan Kloss for multiple meetings, including when the Battle of Exegol was planned. She went on to pilot her A-wing starfighter at the battle, which resulted in a Resistance victory. She later celebrated the victory with her wife back on Ajan Kloss.
Biography
Joining and serving the Resistance

The wife of the human Larma D'Acy, Wrobie Tyce was formerly a courier pilot operating on Warlentta, D'Acy's homeworld. When D'Acy decided to join the Resistance movement, Tyce was in full support, and she even decided to join along with her, changing from being a commercial pilot to one of combat. She went on to fly in the Resistance's Cobalt Squadron, helping the unit to defend Fabrin and the Nanth'ri Trade Route.

Tyce was not present at the Resistance's retreat from D'Qar in 34 ABY, as she was away on a mission with fellow pilot Snap Wexley. The rest of her squadron was annihilated during the retreat, and Tyce was later reassigned under the command of Wexley. Afterward, Tyce was greatly relieved when she learned that her wife had survived the Battle of Crait,  and she reunited with D'Acy following the battle. At some point, she flew her starfighter through an asteroid field.

In 35 ABY, Tyce was present on the Resistance base on the moon Ajan Kloss when it was revealed that Emperor Palpatine had returned and was hiding in the Unknown Regions on a world called Exegol. She later participated in a briefing where the Battle of Exegol was planned, during which she asked General Poe Dameron how the Xyston-class Star Destroyers of Palpatine's Final Order were able to take off. Dameron explained that they used a signal from a navigation tower. The former stormtrooper Finn further explained that the ground team would take down the tower, preventing the Star Destroyers from leaving the atmosphere. While by her A-wing interceptor, Tyce was given a goodbye kiss by D'Acy.
Battle of Exegol
The battle commences

Tyce and the Resistance starfighters flew to Exegol using instructions provided by the Jedi-in-training Rey. When they arrived at Exegol, Tyce pointed out that neither the Falcon nor any additional allies had yet to arrive. She flew in an A-wing during the battle and was part of the attack force that intended on destroying the navigation tower. However, as she pointed out when they approached it, it was deactivated upon their arrival. Tyce further explained that that meant that the tower was no longer transmitting a signal. Finn discovered that the nav signal had been transferred to come from the Final Order's command ship, the Resurgent-class Star Destroyer Steadfast. When he suggested that that ship would be their drop zone, Tyce questioned his intention to launch a ground invasion on a Star Destroyer. Finn admitted that he did not want to but that there was no other choice.

Tyce and the other wings covered the troop carrier as it landed on the Steadfast. Later in the battle, the Resistance pilots began to doubt that any reinforcements would be arriving. When Dameron was asked by the Mon Calamari Aftab Ackbar what they would do, he told them that they would need to hit the Destroyers' cannons themselves. Tyce asked what their fighters would be able to do against Destroyers of their size; Dameron responded that they would just try to stay alive. When he asked if they were with him, Tyce said that she was.
Reinforcements arrive

When many of the Resistance's fighters began to be shot down, Tyce asked Dameron if they needed to retreat. Just as Dameron prepared to order such a retreat, the reinforcement were brought by General Lando Calrissian, and the command ship was destroyed by Finn and the former First Order stormtrooper Jannah. When Dameron attempted to save the pair, who were still on the Steadfast, Tyce warned that he would not be able to make it back in time. Dameron insisted he was fast, but Calrissian flew in to do the job, reminding him that he was not as fast as his ship, the Millennium Falcon.

Tyce returned to Ajan Kloss with the rest of the Resistance and participated in the celebrations there along with D'Acy, whom she hugged and kissed for a long time. She later danced about during the celebrations.
Personality and traits

Tyce supported her wife, D'Acy, even enough to join the Resistance with her. After the Battle of Crait, Tyce was much relieved to hear that D'Acy had survived. During the Battle of Exegol, when Commander Dameron asked his starfighter pilots if they were with him, she was quick to assure him that she was. When Dameron tried to save Finn and Jannah by himself, Tyce was worried for him and tried to tell him to stop. Tyce was a human female with black hair, brown skin, and brown eyes.
Skills and abilities
Originally just a courier pilot, Tyce was able to adapt her flying skills to become a starfighter pilot.
Equipment
Tyce wore a flight suit and utilized a green-and-white RZ-2 A-wing interceptor. She also wore a flight helmet that bore the logo of Cobalt Squadron.
Behind the scenes

Wrobie Tyce first appeared in the 2019 sequel trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode IX The Rise of Skywalker, where she was portrayed by Vinette Robinson. Her surname was revealed in the credits, and her first name was given in the accompanying reference book Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker: The Visual Dictionary, written by Pablo Hidalgo. The graphic novel adaptation for The Rise of Skywalker slightly modifies Tyce's dialogue, changing "The navigation tower has been deactivated" to "The navigation tower! It's been deactivated!"
